Notes.Text:
This update for squashfs fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2015-4645,CVE-2015-4646: Multiple buffer overflows fixed in squashfs-tools (bsc#935380)
- CVE-2021-40153: Fixed an issue where an attacker might have been
  able to write a file outside of destination (bsc#1189936)
- CVE-2021-41072: Fixed an issue where an attacker might have been
  able to write a file outside the destination directory via a
  symlink (bsc#1190531).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: Integer overflow in the read_fragment_table_4 function in unsquash-4.c in Squashfs and sasquatch allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:squashfs-4.6.1-8.3.2

Vulnerabilities.Description: (1) unsquash-1.c, (2) unsquash-2.c, (3) unsquash-3.c, and (4) unsquash-4.c in Squashfs and sasquatch allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:squashfs-4.6.1-8.3.2

Vulnerabilities.Description: squashfs_opendir in unsquash-1.c in Squashfs-Tools 4.5 stores the filename in the directory entry; this is then used by unsquashfs to create the new file during the unsquash. The filename is not validated for traversal outside of the destination directory, and thus allows writing to locations outside of the destination.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:squashfs-4.6.1-8.3.2

Vulnerabilities.Description: squashfs_opendir in unsquash-2.c in Squashfs-Tools 4.5 allows Directory Traversal, a different vulnerability than CVE-2021-40153. A squashfs filesystem that has been crafted to include a symbolic link and then contents under the same filename in a filesystem can cause unsquashfs to first create the symbolic link pointing outside the expected directory, and then the subsequent write operation will cause the unsquashfs process to write through the symbolic link elsewhere in the filesystem.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:squashfs-4.6.1-8.3.2
